question.text: A person was advised to do urine tests and a blood tests for glucose. Glucose was detected in his urine. He was not taking any medications. Which of the following values will correspond to the amount of glucose in the blood of a person?

options.text: 200 mg of glucose per 100 ml of blood
140 mg of glucose per 100 ml of blood
120 mg of glucose per 100 ml of blood
100 mg of glucose per 100 ml of blood

solution.text: The renal threshold of glucose is 160–180 mg per 100 ml of blood. If the blood values of glucose are below this level, the kidneys will absorb all the glucose from the filtrate. If it rises beyond this value, glucose appears in urine.
